report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-4078 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by CVE-2023-4078, an inappropriate implementation vulnerability in Extensions. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by an inappropriate implementation in Extensions, which could be exploited by an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 115.0.1901.200. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-4077 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by CVE-2023-4077, an Insufficient data validation vulnerability in Extensions. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 115.0.1901.200 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 115.0.1901.200. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-4075 Use after free in Cast
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in Cast, identified as CVE-2023-4075. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 115.0.1901.200 is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) page.

section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-4071. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to update Microsoft Edge to the latest version, which is 115.0.1901.200, to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38157 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a Security Feature Bypass vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-38157, with a CVSS base score of 6.5. The vulnerability requires a user to open a Web Archive file with spoofed origin of the web content in the affected version of Microsoft Edge. Successful exploitation could lead to a major loss of confidentiality, allowing the attacker to view sensitive information. The attacker could bypass a security feature, causing the Edge browser to share additional stored cookies when using the share feature. Microsoft has released a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 115.0.1901.200 to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply this update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating the availability of a complete vendor solution. No specific workaround or mitigation is provided beyond applying the official security update.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38254 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-38254, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability is triggered when a user accesses message queuing, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker would need to send a specially crafted malicious MSMQ packet to a MSMQ server to exploit this vulnerability. The impact is high, leading to a total loss of availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2016, with build numbers specified. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38186 Windows Mobile Device Management Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Mobile Device Management Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2023-38186) has been identified with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges without user interaction. It affects various Windows versions including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022. Microsoft has provided a security update (e.g., build numbers 10.0.19045.3324, 10.0.22621.2134) to address this issue. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For further details and to access the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38184 Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-38184, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the LDAP service through a specially crafted LDAP call. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to win a race condition, and the privileges required are low. Successful exploitation results in a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, including security updates for various Windows versions, such as Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and Windows 10, 11, and 22H2. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38172 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-38172, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, impacting the vulnerable component without requiring user interaction. This vulnerability affects various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, and Windows 11, with specific build numbers. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates for their affected systems to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to determine the support lifecycle for the software, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36914 Windows Smart Card Resource Management Server Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Smart Card Resource Management Server is affected by a Security Feature Bypass vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36914, with a CVSS score of 5.5/4.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the Fast Identity Online (FIDO) secure authentication feature. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The impact includes a total loss of confidentiality but no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36913 Microsoft Message Queuing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36913, with a CVSS score of 6.5/5.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting memory addressing. It has a low attack complexity and requires no user interaction, making it exploitable without any interaction from any user. Any authenticated attacker could trigger this vulnerability, as it does not require admin or other elevated privileges. Microsoft has provided official fixes in the form of security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page for the affected products.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36912 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36912, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, impacting resources managed by the same security authority. It is remotely exploitable, requiring no user interaction and no specialized access conditions. Microsoft has provided official fixes for various affected products, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix. The vulnerability has been confirmed, and no active exploitation has been reported. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36911 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a critical remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36911. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to remotely execute code on the target server. It has a CVSS base score of 9.8 and a temporal score of 8.5. The attack vector is network-based, with low attack complexity and no privileges required. The vulnerability can be exploited without user interaction, leading to high impacts on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows Server versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10, 11, and related variants. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, a mitigating factor is available, where the Windows message queuing service needs to be enabled for a system to be exploitable by this vulnerability, and it can be added via the Control Panel. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36910 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a critical remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36910. The vulnerability allows an attacker to send a specially crafted malicious MSMQ packet to a MSMQ server, resulting in remote code execution on the server side. This vulnerability has a base score of 9.8 and a temporal score of 8.5, indicating a high severity and exploitability. The attack vector is network-based, with low attack complexity and no privileges required, making it exploitable without user interaction. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability loss. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, a mitigation factor involves enabling the Windows message queuing service, which can be added via the Control Panel. For further details, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page for CVE-2023-36910.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36909 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36909, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability is triggered when a user accesses message queuing, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker would need to send a specially crafted malicious MSMQ packet to a MSMQ server to exploit this vulnerability. The attack vector is network-based, with low attack complexity and no privileges required. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and Windows 10. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36908 Windows Hyper-V Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36908, with a CVSS base score of 6.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to access data from the Hyper-V Host. It has a low attack complexity and does not require user interaction, making it exploitable without any user participation. The impact includes high confidentiality loss but no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The attack vector is limited to systems configured to use the Hyper-V Network Virtualization (HNV) logical network, forming an isolation boundary where the attack is confined. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36907 Windows Cryptographic Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cryptographic Services is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36907, with a CVSS score of 5.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of heap memory. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The impact includes high confidentiality loss but no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36906 Windows Cryptographic Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cryptographic Services is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36906, with a CVSS score of 5.5/4.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of heap memory. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. The impact is limited to information disclosure, with no impact on integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36905 Windows Wireless Wide Area Network Service (WwanSvc) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Wireless Wide Area Network Service (WwanSvc) is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36905, with a CVSS score of 5.5/4.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to read small portions of heap memory, and it can be exploited by an authenticated attacker without requiring admin privileges. To exploit it, an attacker would need application level execution rights to the system, or could trick a local user into opening a malicious file. Microsoft has provided security updates for various affected Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2016/2019, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For further details and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36904 Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36904, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, impacting Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server systems. The attack complexity is low, and no user interaction is required for exploitation. Microsoft has provided a security update (build numbers 10.0.19045.3324, 10.0.22621.2134, 10.0.19044.3324, 10.0.22000.2295, 10.0.20348.1906, 10.0.20348.1903, 10.0.17763.4737) to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect the affected systems from unauthorized privilege escalation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36903 Windows System Assessment Tool Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows System Assessment Tool (WSAT) is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36903, with a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain specific limited SYSTEM privileges without user interaction. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows versions including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page for the specific affected products and versions.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36900 Windows Common Log File System Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical elevation of privilege vulnerability, CVE-2023-36900, affects the Windows Common Log File System Driver. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. The impact is rated as important with a CVSS base score of 7.8. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Windows Common Log File System Driver, enabling attackers to exploit it without user interaction. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, 2022, Windows 10, 11, and their respective service packs. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No specific workarounds or mitigations are mentioned, emphasizing the importance of applying the official fix. For more information and to determine the support lifecycle for affected software, system administrators can refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36898 Tablet Windows User Interface Application Core Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Tablet Windows User Interface Application Core is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36898, with a CVSS base score of 7.8 and a temporal score of 6.8. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and has low attack complexity and no privileges required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released security updates for Windows 11 versions 22H2 and 21H2 for x64-based and ARM64-based systems, with build numbers 10.0.22621.2134 and 10.0.22000.2295. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code locally, emphasizing the importance of applying the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. System administrators are advised to prioritize the installation of the official fix to ensure the protection of affected systems. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36889 Windows Group Policy Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Group Policy Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36889, affects various Windows Server and Windows client versions. The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to bypass security features and read specific Group Policy configuration settings. It has a base score of 5.5 and a temporal score of 4.8, indicating a moderate severity level. The attack vector is local, with low attack complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for affected Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36884 Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Search in various Windows products is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, assigned as CVE-2023-36884, with a CVSS score of 7.5/7.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the victim's system by convincing a user to open a specially crafted file, exploiting a high attack complexity. Successful exploitation could lead to high loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided security updates for affected Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and others, with build numbers 10.0.10240.20107, 10.0.19044.3324, 10.0.22000.2295, and more. System administrators are advised to install the August 2023 Windows updates as soon as possible to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The Office updates related to this vulnerability are documented in ADV230003. No specific workaround is provided, and Microsoft recommends immediate installation of the security updates to address this critical vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36882 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36882, with a CVSS score of 8.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application by tricking an authenticated user into connecting to a malicious SQL server via a connection driver. The attack vector is network-based and requires user interaction. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows versions including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, Windows 10, and Windows 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The impact of the vulnerability includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks, making prompt patching essential to prevent potential exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35387 Windows Bluetooth A2DP driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Bluetooth A2DP driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35387. The vulnerability allows an authorized attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges by programmatically running certain functions on the Bluetooth component. Successful exploitation requires the victim to pair with the attacker's Bluetooth device. The attack vector is adjacent, requiring the attacker to gain access to the restricted network before running an attack. The impact is high, with total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35386 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35386, has been reported with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. It has a low attack complexity and requires no user interaction, making it exploitable without any interaction from any user. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability, resulting in total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the impacted component. Microsoft has provided security updates for various affected products, including Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2022, and Windows Server 2019. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35385 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a critical remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-35385. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to remotely execute code on the target server. The attack vector is through the Windows message queuing service, which needs to be enabled for a system to be exploitable. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various affected Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, a mitigating factor is to check if the 'Message Queuing' service is running and TCP port 1801 is listening on the machine. The impact of the vulnerability is severe, with high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available. For further details and specific build numbers for the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35384 Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows HTML Platforms are affected by a security feature bypass vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35384, with a CVSS score of 5.4/4.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass security features by convincing a user to access a URL in a less restricted Internet Security Zone than intended. Exploitation requires user interaction, such as clicking on a specially crafted URL provided by the attacker. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability by correcting security feature behavior to properly map affected URLs to the correct Security Zone. The affected products include all supported versions of Microsoft Windows except Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, and Windows Server 2012. To stay fully protected, Microsoft recommends that customers who install Security Only updates also install the IE Cumulative updates for this vulnerability. The underlying MSHTML, EdgeHTML, and scripting platforms are still supported despite the retirement of Internet Explorer 11 and deprecation of Microsoft Edge Legacy. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the protection of their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35383 Microsoft Message Queuing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35383, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read User Mode Service Memory without requiring any user interaction. It impacts various Windows Server and Windows client versions. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for the affected products, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available. The vulnerability's impact on confidentiality is high, leading to the total loss of confidentiality for the affected components. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35382 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35382, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges by exploiting the Windows Kernel. The attack vector is local, requiring the attacker to have local access to the targeted machine with low privileges. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows 10 and 11, as well as Windows Server 2019 and 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The vulnerability's impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks, potentially leading to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the impacted component. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating that a complete vendor solution is available. The attacker's privileges required are low, and the vulnerability can be exploited without any user interaction. For further details and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35381 Windows Fax Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Fax Service is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35381, with a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code without requiring user interaction. Exploitation involves convincing a user to open a specially crafted file, potentially through email or web-based attack scenarios. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, Windows 10, and Windows 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For further details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35380 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35380, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges by exploiting a flaw in the Windows Kernel. The attack vector is local, requiring the attacker to have local access to the targeted machine and the ability to create folders and performance traces with restricted privileges. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates based on their Windows version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The affected products include various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019 and 2022. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Guide page for CVE-2023-35380.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35378 Windows Projected File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Projected File System is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-35378, with a base score of 7.0 and a temporal score of 6.1. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges without requiring admin or other elevated privileges. Successful exploitation requires the optional Projected Filesystem component to be enabled, which is not a default configuration. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attack complexity is high, and the vulnerability can be exploited without any user interaction. The impact includes total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability, making it important to prioritize the installation of the security updates. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35377 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35377. The vulnerability has a base score of 6.5 and a temporal score of 5.7, indicating a high impact on availability. It is remotely exploitable, requiring a specially crafted malicious MSMQ packet to be sent to a MSMQ server, triggered when a user accesses message queuing, leading to a denial of service. The attack complexity is low, and no privileges or user interaction are required. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of the impacted components.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35376 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35376, with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability is triggered when a user accesses message queuing, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker would need to send a specially crafted malicious MSMQ packet to a MSMQ server to exploit this vulnerability. The impact is high, leading to a total loss of availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35359 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35359, has been addressed by Microsoft. The vulnerability has a base score of 7.8 and impacts Windows Server and Windows operating systems, including Windows 10 and Windows 11. The attack vector is local, requiring low privileges, and can be exploited without user interaction. Successful exploitation could grant the attacker SYSTEM privileges. Microsoft has provided official fixes in the form of security updates for the affected Windows versions. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of elevation of privilege attacks. For more information and to access the specific security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-20569 AMD: CVE-2023-20569 Return Address Predictor
section_1_data.summary: The AMD CVE-2023-20569 Return Address Predictor vulnerability affects certain processor models offered by AMD, leading to information disclosure. This vulnerability requires a Windows update for mitigation. Microsoft has enabled the mitigation in the latest builds of Windows to protect against the vulnerability. Customers allowing untrusted code execution may need to implement extra security features. Microsoft has seen performance impact with these mitigations, particularly when hyperthreading is disabled. Azure Virtual Machine offerings using certain AMD EPYC processors are affected, but an update is being deployed across Azure infrastructure to secure most customers automatically. However, a small subset of customers with custom Maintenance Configurations on their Azure Virtual Machines may need to apply the update. Microsoft Azure assets are being protected through the deployment of mitigations. Customers can refer to the AMD advisory to determine affected CPUs. Windows updates are available for various versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, to address the information disclosure vulnerability. Microsoft continues to work with hardware vendors to improve performance while maintaining a high level of security.

section_1_data.title: ADV230001 Guidance on Microsoft Signed Drivers Being Used Maliciously
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has addressed the issue of malicious use of drivers certified by Microsoft’s Windows Hardware Developer Program (MWHDP) in post-exploitation activity. The attackers gained administrative privileges on compromised systems before using the drivers. Microsoft has suspended the partners' seller accounts and implemented blocking detections for all reported malicious drivers. Windows Security updates have been released to untrust drivers and driver signing certificates for the impacted files. Microsoft recommends installing the latest Windows updates and ensuring anti-virus and endpoint detection products are up to date. The issue does not affect Microsoft services. Microsoft is working with MAPP partners to develop further detections and protect customers. Customers can deploy their own Hypervisor-protected Code Integrity (HVCI) policy to perform detections in their environment. Offline scans are required to detect malicious drivers installed prior to the new Microsoft detections. No official fix is provided, but customers are advised to install the latest Windows updates and maintain up-to-date anti-virus and endpoint detection products to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36884 Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Search is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36884, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the victim's system by convincing a user to take action, such as clicking a link or opening a malicious attachment. Successful exploitation could lead to high loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server 2012, 2016, and 2019. System administrators are advised to install the August 2023 Windows updates as soon as possible to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attack complexity is high, and no user interaction is required for exploitation. The attacker can plant a malicious file evading Mark of the Web (MOTW) defenses, resulting in code execution on the victim system.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-29360 Microsoft Streaming Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Streaming Service is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-29360. The vulnerability has a base score of 8.4 and a temporal score of 7.3, indicating a high impact. It allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges without user interaction. The affected products include various versions of Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server, and Windows Server 2016. Microsoft has provided security updates for the impacted products to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is available, and an official fix is confirmed to be available. Microsoft acknowledges the efforts of the security community in coordinated vulnerability disclosure. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36900 Windows Common Log File System Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Windows Common Log File System Driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36900, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and it has a low attack complexity and requires no user interaction. This vulnerability impacts various Windows Server versions, including 2008, 2012, and 2016, as well as Windows 10 and 11. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for the affected platforms. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is available, and the remediation level is marked as 'Official Fix,' suggesting that a complete vendor solution is available. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-35387 Windows Bluetooth A2DP driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Bluetooth A2DP driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-35387. The vulnerability allows an authorized attacker to programmatically run certain functions, leading to elevation of privilege on the Bluetooth component, potentially gaining SYSTEM privileges. Successful exploitation requires the victim to pair with the attacker's Bluetooth device. The attack vector is adjacent, requiring the attacker to gain access to the restricted network before running an attack. The vulnerability affects various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server 2012, 2016, and 2019. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability, and system administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation.
